description: This file defines a React hook 'useGeolocation' that provides user location information with handling for permission states and errors. It leverages the browser's geolocation API and permissions API to monitor and retrieve the user's latitude and longitude, exposing this data for use in React components.

methods.name: useGeolocation(options = {})
methods.description: Main hook function that manages geolocation state, permission status, and error handling, providing the current position, error info, permission status, and a refresh method.

methods.name: readPermission
methods.description: Asynchronously checks and updates the user's geolocation permission status.

methods.name: mapError
methods.description: Converts geolocation error codes into human-readable error objects.

methods.name: locate
methods.description: Attempts to retrieve the current position of the user and updates state accordingly.
